Complementary colors are pairs of colors which, when combined or mixed, cancel each other out (lose hue) by producing a grayscale color like white or black. When placed next to each other, they create the strongest contrast for those particular two colors.

The color wheel can be divided into primary, secondary and tertiary colors. Primary colors are the most basic colors. They are colors that can't be created by mixing any other colors. Secondary colors are created by mixing primary colors. Tertiary colors are created by mixing primary and secondary colors.
